snippet: Violent confrontations have erupted over an urban plan that would link infrastructure development in Addis Ababa with that of surrounding towns home to the Oromo ethnic group.
abstract: Unrest in central Ethiopia over plan to expand Addis Ababa's infrastructure into region which is home to Oromo ethnic group has reportedly killed dozens of people; government's push to maximize country's recent economic progress is criticized as quasi-autocratic approach which disregards rights of Ethiopia's over 80 ethnic groups.
lead_paragraph: Violent confrontations have erupted over an urban plan that would link infrastructure development in Addis Ababa with that of surrounding towns home to the Oromo ethnic group.

headline.main: Ethiopians on Edge as Infrastructure Plan Stirs Protests
headline.print_headline: Ethnic Group in Ethiopia Challenges Urban Plan
